intro: Decaschistia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered decaschistia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. It is a herbaceous plant with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, giving the plant a delicate appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
